page.title: 07Village Life,Turvey
page.content: Children aged 5-9 go to school at the new lower school in May Road.From the age of 9-13 they attend the middle school,Harrold Priory School travelling there by school coach.After 13 they go to Sharnbrook Upper School.Further and adult education has to be taken in Bedford and Sharnbrook. Turvey is well served by shops having 6.There are 3 general stores which each provide special services; an off-licence,a newsagents and a delicatessen.The village has a post office,butcher and a baby wear shop.A Milkman,mobile fishmonger and a greengrocer visit the village. 83.6% of Turvey residents own at least 1 car.Most people travel to work by car(65.7%) but 17% walk,reflecting the number of residents who work in Turvey.Only 8.6% use the bus service.
